5121.quoteText: We can change these Terms at any time. We keep a historical record of all changes to our Terms on GitHub. If a change is material, we’ll let you know before they take effect. By using Medium on or after that effective date, you agree to the new Terms. If you don’t agree to them, you should delete your account before they take effect, otherwise your use of the site and content will be subject to the new Terms.

tosdr.case: Users should revisit the terms periodically, although in case of material changes, the service will notify

5122.quoteText: You own the rights to the content you create and post on Medium.

5123.quoteText:
No children

Medium is only for people 13 years old and over. By using Medium, you affirm that you are over 13. If we learn someone under 13 is using Medium, we’ll terminate their account.

5124.quoteText: Disclaimer of warranty. Medium provides the Services to you as is. You use them at your own risk and discretion. That means they don’t come with any warranty. None express, none implied. No implied warranty of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, availability, security, title or non-infringement.

5125.quoteText: Limitation of Liability. Medium won’t be liable to you for any damages that arise from your using the Services. This includes if the Services are hacked or unavailable. This includes all types of damages (indirect, incidental, consequential, special or exemplary). And it includes all kinds of legal claims, such as breach of contract, breach of warranty, tort, or any other loss.

5126.quoteText: Choice of law and jurisdiction. These Terms are governed by California law, without reference to its conflict of laws provisions. You agree that any suit arising from the Services must take place in a court located in San Francisco, California.

5128.quoteText: If you receive a DMCA notification, it means that the content described in the notice has been removed from Medium or access to the content on Medium has been restricted.
5128.title: If you are the target of a copyright claim, your content may be removed

tosdr.case: If you are the target of a copyright claim, your content may be removed

5129.quoteText:
If you received a DMCA notification about your material and believe that material was misidentified or removed in error, you should file a counter-notice by following the instructions below.

Re-posting material removed in response to a DMCA notification may result in permanent account suspension. If you believe the content was removed in error, please file a counter-notice instead of re-posting the material.

5131.quoteText:
You can delete any of your posts, or your account, anytime.
Processing the deletion may take a little time, but we’ll do it as quickly as possible.
We may keep backup copies of your deleted post or account on our servers for up to 14 days after you delete it.
